description: Two knights observe a scene where a small, winged creature has just emerged from a large, broken egg. The eggshell is depicted with a face and appears visibly shocked and distressed by the hatching, lying in two main pieces with fragments scattered around. This anthropomorphization of the inanimate eggshell creates an absurd and surreal element. The setting is implied to be near a stone wall, possibly part of a castle. The humor arises from the focus on the egg's 'suffering' rather than the newly hatched creature, highlighting the ironic perspective of the observers.
caption: “Look. ... You wanna try putting him back together again?”
